intro: Hedysarum pallidum subsp. intactum, commonly known as the pale vetch, is a perennial legume native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and trifoliate leaves with hairy surfaces. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in racemes, which bloom in early summer. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several small, rounded seeds. Hedysarum pallidum subsp. intactum is adapted to dry, rocky habitats and plays a role in soil stabilization and nitrogen fixation.
